Talent Acquisition Consultant

Company Name Contino Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 119 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Contino we are experiencing incredible growth in our APAC region! We partner with the world's leading brands to accelerate innovation through the successful adoption of Enterprise DevOps, Cloud Native Computing and Data Platforms. Contino are leading Hashicorp, Kubernetes and AWS Premier partners.

We have built an amazing team of passionate technologists and are an advocate for challenging intelligent and talented people, like you! You'd be working with a team of fun, professional and passionate people with a keen eye for innovation, curiosity and a love of technology.

Desired Skills and Experience:

  • An innovative and creative mind in ways we can attract, source and retain some of the most talented people in the technology space.
  • A passion and hunger to help Contino succeed and grow into a highly successful strategic technology partner.
  • A keen understanding of the Software Engineering and Development space, as well as experience of knolwedge of the DevOps movement, Cloud technologies and innovation at enterprise.
  • Positive outlook on engaging people on and off of the market
  • Ability to sell our vision, our passion and our career opportunities effectively and fluently.
  • The ability to communicate to highly technical individuals about who we are, what we do and how we do it.
  • Be charismatic, enthusiastic and have a friendly demeanor.
  • Be approachable and easy going, as you'll be exposed to everyone within Contino


Key Skills

  • 18 months minimum experience in a 360 view Recruitment Consultant or Talent Acquisition role either in-house or agency-side.
  • Ideally experience in working in a smaller team and proven ability of autonomy in your work and organic sourcing.
  • Understanding of technology and recruitment at enterprise is desired, but high growth recruitment is ideal (building teams, advising hiring management etc.)
  • Demonstrable experience of recruitment within the technical space is ideal.
  • High levels of organisation around administrative tasks.
  • Confident in interviewing people at early technical and pre-screening stages.
  • A bonus would be to have an understanding of HR practices (if you have qualifications, make sure you mention them)
  • Strong understanding of utilising CMS/CRM systems such as Bullhorn, Greenhouse, Workable and so on (we use Workable!)
  • If you have experience of running, creating or regularly attending meetups or industry events then you'll get kudos!18

Benefits:

Because you thrive in a hyper-growth company and view the challenge of building as an opportunity for tremendous professional development and learning. You want the ability to think and act entrepreneurially; to see the results of your work have immediate impact on the business. You enjoy surrounding yourself with passionate, highly experienced people who will support and push you to be your absolute best. And most importantly, you believe in respect for your ideas and appreciate recognition for hard work and a job well-done.

And let's be honest, you also want a Competitive Salary and company sponsored professional training.

Technology Services Planner (Events Industry)

Company Name Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre Company Location 1 Convention Centre Place , South Wharf, VIC 3006, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 32 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Supporting customers with advice on AV event technology
  • Customer facing
  • Use of Turbo CAD


Due to our growth, we have a fantastic opportunity for a Technology Services Planner within our Planning team.


The position


As a Technology Services Planner, your primary responsibility will be to assist each of our clients with their event by providing advice, support and solutions for their audio visual requirements. To be considered for this role you will need to be able to demonstrate excellence in customer service focus and capability.

You will be supporting our customers by:

  • Preparing quotes, floor plans, schematics and other documentation as required for the event.
  • Providing briefings for internal stakeholders involved in the delivery and execution of the client event.
  • Keeping accurate event documentation and ensuring the event plan is up to date.
  • Providing regular and timely communication via phone and email.
  • Participating in pre and post event briefings with the customer event team.
  • Contributing positively to the Planning team and other critical stakeholders in our business.
  • Be assisting our customers in coordinating and planning the technology and production requirements for events of up to 5500 people (or more!). You can expect to be working in a very busy and varied role with a great team to support you.


You have....

  • The ability to multi-task and deliver outcomes within the required timeframes
  • Excellent organisation skills, you are efficient – \xa0and prepared to go the extra mile to ensure everything from the production planning to event execution meets the highest standards of service we expect at MCEC.
  • An extraordinary attention to detail - part of this role will be coordinating documentation for both internal and external stakeholders, to ensure the event runs to plan and meets the customer’s requirements.
  • Outstanding communication skills – much of this role involves communicating with our customers (internal and external) by phone, face to face and by means of written correspondence.
  • Experience in the technical production planning and delivery in an event context - candidates who have a background in technical operations would be at an advantage.
  • \xa0Initiative and a ‘can do’ attitude – by anticipating issues, trouble-shooting and resolving challenges \xa0you will ensure our customers have a positive experience at MCEC.
  • A desire to work as part of a team and can demonstrate the ability to work with key stakeholders and build positive relationships to achieve a great outcome.
  • Proficient skills in MS Office, CAD programs and general database/software packages.


Why MCEC?

You will be joining a fantastic, committed and experienced team, in an amazing location with an iconic brand. MCEC offers many staff benefits including but not limited to -, learning and development opportunities, reward and recognition programs and flexible start and finish times.

If you have the right experience and are excited about an opportunity to join the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre, then apply now by attaching your resume and a cover letter outlining why you are suitable for this role.


Applications will be reviewed as they come in and suitable candidates contacted for an interview, so don’t hesitate to apply!\xa0Applications to be submitted online, not by email.

At this stage only applicants with valid working rights in Australia are encouraged to apply!

Who we are:


We are Initiative.

Company Name Commonwealth Bank Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 56 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Multiple opportunities for a Home Lending Specialist - Eastern Suburbs
  • You’re focused on building trust, confidence and long term relationships with your customers
  • We’re focused on helping our customers secure and enhance their financial wellbeing
  • Together we’re delivering exceptional home lending experiences, where the customer is centre of everything we do.


Do work that matters

Your role exists to make our customer’s lives easier. Whether a customer is buying their first or second home, investing in a property, refinancing, building or renovating, you’re there to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

Our Home Lending Specialists (HLS) are the type of people who thrive on creating long-lasting relationships. They know how to ask the right questions to deliver appropriate lending solutions and build trust, confidence and advocacy in every interaction.

See yourself in our team

You’ll be joining our Retail Branch Network - a hardworking team who deliver customised service to meet the needs of our personal and small business customers. Our focus is to help people and business move forward, to progress. We support our customers to make the right financial decisions and achieve their dreams, targets and aspirations.

We’re looking for someone who puts the customer at the heart of everything they do. You’ll work face to face with customers to lead lending conversations with confidence, putting your solid understanding of our products, processes and policies to good use by proactively identifying your customers’ financial needs. As a confident networker you'll use your communications skills to develop and maintain strong working relationships with your branch peers.

As an HLS, you’ll be a stickler for detail, ensuring applications are compliant and all checks have been done. The service you provide will be exceptional, giving you the confidence to ask for external referrals from your existing satisfied customers.

Where will you go?

As an HLS at CommBank, your opportunities are endless. We’re investing in in our people to provide consistent and clear career pathways for our lenders, deliver more development opportunities and provide best in market training.

If you live the values and demonstrate our lending capabilities, we’ll help you find the next step that’s right for you and enable you to be your best on your career journey.

We’re Interested In Hearing From People Who Have
  • A proven track record of delivering exceptional customer service and establishing and maintaining rewarding relationships
  • Previous experience in a lending environment and an existing knowledge of Home Lending products and the current responsible lending legislation
  • An ability to identify and anticipate customers’ financial needs
  • The ability to see the big picture for customers and provide them with holistic solutions

865153888:
[

Power Engineer, Power Supply Upgrade Project

Company Name Yarra Trams Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About this job

Keolis Downer is the proud operator of Yarra Trams, the oldest and largest light rail network in the world. Since 2009, Keolis Downer has significantly invested in Melbourne’s tram network and community. In September last year, the Victorian Government has awarded Keolis Downer the contract to run Yarra Trams until at least 2024. This is an exciting time for the team at Yarra Trams as we begin delivery of our new franchise term.

\xa0

In the next seven years we will continue to bring our international expertise to Melbourne to ensure we continue to deliver even better, safer, more reliable passenger services and performance, while increasing the value of the tram network for Melburnians and the thousands of visitors to our city every day.

\xa0

To deliver on these exciting new challenges, Yarra Trams requires the services of an experienced Power Engineer to support the delivery and closeout of all power related upgrades to the traction network associated with the Power Supply Upgrade Project (PSUP).

\xa0

What the role entails

This is a great opportunity for an experienced Power Engineer to assist in the delivery of traction power upgrades and associated modifications to the traction system on behalf of PTV.

\xa0

Reporting to the Principal Project Manager, PSUP, the role involves:

  • Reviewing design drawings, testing and commissioning plans, reporting and providing technical advice;
  • Providing advice and resolving issues associated with the design, co-ordination of HV supply, substation and traction system design;
  • Providing technical advice to the Project Manager on issues relating to on-site activities, design documents and performance of contractors;
  • Preparing scopes of work documents, design concepts, technical specifications and technical assessments;
  • Undertaking research, analysis, interpretation and development of industry best practice to create innovative options;
  • Providing recommendations for continuous improvement to all systems and processes;
  • Identifying safety risk as a result of deviations from Yarra Trams standards and specifications;
  • Assisting in the auditing and supervision of contractors for site-related activities.

\xa0

What you will need for this role

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • 2-5yrs Project related experience;
  • Tertiary qualifications in Electrical Engineering or similar;
  • Technical knowledge of heavy AC or DC power systems;
  • Technical Knowledge of single line diagrams, Interlocking, control systems, insulation co-ordination, AC and DC switchgear, earthing systems, electrolysis systems and associated design;
  • Technical knowledge of 48VDC battery & SCADA system designs (incl. telecommunications infrastructure);
  • Knowledge of D&C contracts, consultancy contracts and associated accountabilities;
  • Knowledge of testing and commissioning processes;
  • Demonstrable experience in the coordination of HV requirements, substation and traction system designs (including all supporting discipline designs);
  • Well-developed analytical and decision making skills;
  • Strong written, verbal communication and inter personal skills;
  • Experience with MS Office Suite, Project Management software, engineering and design specific software (e.g. Siprotec, Siemens S7, Mathcad Prime, Autocad).

\xa0

Interested? To apply for this vacancy, please visit our careers website at http://jobs.yarratrams.com.au and complete an online application form. Only completed online application forms will be accepted.

\xa0

Applications close: 18th September 2018

859300961:
[

Senior Interior Designer

Company Name M Moser Associates Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 87 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

To expand our ever growing team, M Moser Associates is looking for creative Interior Designers to join our Global Design Team. This role will be based in our Melbourne office but you will be working on projects across the APAC region with some travel required. The successful candidate must have demonstrated strong conceptual design skills and have experience working on large scale workplace projects. The successful candidate must be a self-starter who is entrepreneurial in spirit but able to work as part of a global team across geographic locations.


Why Work With Us?

At M Moser Associates, we see the world differently. Our DNA is design and implementation - we revel in those who are as passionate as we are to challenge the status quo and build great things as part of a team. \xa0We focus greatly on our people, providing them with opportunities to grow and develop professionally, while appreciating their diverse skill sets and backgrounds. When you join M Moser Associates you become part of a global community that wants to see you succeed.


Working with M Moser Associates Australia, you will become a part of Global Design Center for Excellence. Based in our Melbourne office, you will be exposed to international clients and have the opportunity to collaborate with a wide range of experts from an even wider range of backgrounds. What set’s this office apart from our others is the opportunity to travel and work with the local teams in different geographical locations all over the world. Sound interesting?



What's The Job?\xa0

The job of the Senior Interior Designer is to lead concept design and storytelling with a cross disciplinary team to define new experiences and opportunities for M Moser Associate’s clients. The role will include, but not be limited to:

  • Consulting with clients to establish design concepts and parameters, including how the space will function, budget considerations, and aesthetic preferences
  • Generating conceptual designs using a variety of graphic techniques, including hand-drawn and computer-generated visuals, and prepare preliminary cost estimates
  • Presenting design concepts to team members and clients for approval
  • Preparing written specifications, working drawings, and construction documents, including verification that designs meet applicable building codes where necessary
  • Working with a multi-disciplinary team to deliver and win work through design presentation opportunities
  • Supervising the work and progress of design team drawings, studies, specifications and other project tasks on multiple projects
  • Establishing and maintaining trust between the project team, client and other project stakeholders
  • Monitoring and maintaining a high level of design quality within the project team.
  • Problem-solving project design issues and applying inventive solutions.

Who Are You?

A Senior Interior Designer with M Moser is a seasoned, out-of-the-box thinker, with an exceptional knack and portfolio for delivering awe-inspiring ideas for corporate workplace clients. For this role, M Moser is looking for:

  • At least 8 years’ experience in workplace interiors
  • Knowledge of local codes and permitting
  • A portfolio of signature conceptual design work, including some large workplace and transformation projects
  • Strong experience in maintaining design integrity from design concept to on-site construction
  • Experience in efficiently contributing to and supervising multiple projects at the same time
  • Interest and practice mentoring younger designers and promoting a positive attitude
  • A self-starter who can motivate themselves and the team around them
  • Someone with a desire to work on high profile global workplace projects
  • The ability and desire to travel throughout APAC (working with locally based teams


What's Next?

If this sounds like you, please send us your CV, work samples and a short cover letter to meaghans@mmoser.com

\xa0

M Moser is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
